title.value: Methods, Applications, and Directions of Learning-to-Rank in NLP Research
title.justification: The title of the paper is given at the beginning of the document and describes the focus on learning-to-rank methods in Natural Language Processing.
title.quote: Title: Methods, Applications, and Directions of Learning-to-Rank in NLP Research

extractions.description: This survey paper explores various learning-to-rank (LTR) methods used in NLP. It discusses the formal background, application cases, and future directions of LTR in the context of NLP, with particular attention to statistical significance testing and the impact of large language models (LLMs).

type.justification: The paper primarily surveys existing methods and applications of LTR in NLP rather than conducting new experiments or empirical studies.
type.quote: This is a theoretical paper that surveys the diverse use-cases of LTR methods in natural language processing research.

name.justification: The paper is focused on learning-to-rank methods within the scope of Natural Language Processing applications and challenges.
name.quote: This survey is aimed at NLP researchers and practitioners interested in understanding the formalisms and best practices regarding the application of LTR approaches in their research.

name.justification: LTR is commonly used in information retrieval tasks, as highlighted in the paper.
name.quote: Ranking, i.e., ordering according to some property, is a central problem for many natural language processing (NLP) and information retrieval (IR) tasks.

name.justification: RankNet is one of the pairwise models discussed for optimizing ranking objectives.
name.quote: RankNet (Burges et al., 2005), LambdaRank (Burges et al., 2006), and LambdaMART (Burges, 2010) use gradient descent to update a pairwise model.

is_contributed.justification: RankNet is referenced and used as an example rather than a contribution from this paper.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not mention executing models, as it is a theoretical survey of methods.
is_executed.quote: The paper focuses on methods and literature, not on executing models.

is_compared.justification: RankNet is mentioned as an existing model, not one being numerically compared in this paper's scope.
is_compared.quote: The paper surveys pairwise models without specific numeric comparisons among them.

referenced_paper_title.value: Learning to rank using gradient descent
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper provides the original description of RankNet.

name.justification: LambdaRank is discussed as a method that optimizes for a specific ranking metric directly.
name.quote: LambdaRank bypasses this in favor of directly defining a gradient function that can optimize for a specific metric.

is_contributed.justification: LambdaRank is a referenced method rather than a new contribution of this paper.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not cover executing models as it is focused on theory and survey.
is_executed.quote: The focus is on survey and formal background.

is_compared.justification: LambdaRank is referenced without direct numeric comparisons in this paper.
is_compared.quote: The paper references LambdaRank but does not compare it numerically to others.

referenced_paper_title.value: Learning to rank with nonsmooth cost functions
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper details the LambdaRank model, its development, and applications.

name.justification: LambdaMART is mentioned as a model applying the LambdaRank objective with boosted regression trees.
name.quote: LambdaMART implements the LambdaRank objective with boosted regression trees.

is_contributed.justification: LambdaMART is mentioned as part of existing literature and not as a new contribution by this survey.

is_executed.justification: Execution of models is not within the scope as this paper is focused on exposing methods.
is_executed.quote: Execution of models is not discussed in the paper.

is_compared.justification: It is referenced among models but not directly compared in this survey.
is_compared.quote: The paper mentions LambdaMART but does not compare it with other models.

referenced_paper_title.value: From RankNet to LambdaRank to LambdaMART: An overview
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper by Burges outlines the LambdaMART model, referenced by this survey.

name.justification: SVMrank is noted for framing pairwise ranking problems and is cited as a popular method within NLP tasks.
name.quote: SVMrank (Joachims, 2002) frames the pairwise ranking objective within the SVM algorithm, and has been a popular choice in NLP.

is_contributed.justification: The paper mentions SVMrank as part of literature, not as a new finding.

is_executed.justification: The paper does not conduct any model executions per se.
is_executed.quote: The focus remains theoretical, not executional.

is_compared.justification: There is no numerical comparison of SVMrank performed in this survey paper.
is_compared.quote: Popular SVMrank is mentioned but not numerically compared here.

referenced_paper_title.value: Optimizing search engines using clickthrough data
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference highlights SVMrank used for optimization of search engine results.

name.justification: ListNet is highlighted for its probabilistic ranking model approach and its usage.
name.quote: Listwise ListNet (Cao et al., 2007) is a probabilistic ranking model where the probability of a list item being ranked in the first position for all other items, is predicted.

is_contributed.justification: ListNet is a discussed method within the survey, not a new contribution.

is_executed.justification: Theoretical discussions on the model execute no code or experiments.
is_executed.quote: ListNet is examined as part of theoretical methods.

is_compared.justification: The paper outlines ListNet without direct quantitative comparison with others.
is_compared.quote: ListNet is outlined without a direct comparison in this paper.

referenced_paper_title.value: Learning to rank: from pairwise approach to listwise approach
referenced_paper_title.justification: The original development of ListNet is documented in this paper by Cao et al.

name.justification: ListMLE is referenced for its use of a different loss function for listwise ranking methods.
name.quote: ListMLE (Xia et al., 2008) builds on ListNet by proposing an alternative loss function.

is_contributed.justification: ListMLE is covered within the survey scope but not as a contribution.

is_executed.justification: Scope remains on discussing models, not Factual execution.
is_executed.quote: The survey provides theoretical rather than empirical execution.

is_compared.justification: No comparative analysis given or numerical results are presented.
is_compared.quote: ListMLE is discussed but not compared to others numerically.

referenced_paper_title.value: Listwise approach to learning to rank: theory and algorithm
referenced_paper_title.justification: The foundational ideas on ListMLE are developed in this referenced paper authored by Xia et al.

name.justification: RankT5 is a newer model fine-tuning T5 to extend both pairwise and listwise ranking losses.
name.quote: RankT5 (Zhuang et al., 2022) fine-tunes the T5 model to extend to both pairwise and listwise ranking losses.

is_contributed.justification: RankT5 is discussed as a model of interest, not as a contribution of this paper.

is_executed.justification: Execution isn't discussed; the paper surveys models conceptually.
is_executed.quote: It is examined for its relevance, not execution status.

is_compared.justification: RankT5 is mentioned without numerical comparison being conducted.
is_compared.quote: The paper discusses RankT5 without presenting comparisons.

referenced_paper_title.value: Fine-tuning T5 for text ranking with ranking losses
referenced_paper_title.justification: The discussed model RankT5 is detailed in the referenced work by Zhuang et al.

name.justification: ListBERT is highlighted for fine-tuning a RoBERTa model on listwise losses to rank products.
name.quote: ListBERT (Kumar and Sarkar, 2022) finetunes a RoBERTa model with several listwise losses for ranking e-commerce products.

is_contributed.justification: It is part of the literature overviewed rather than a new contribution of the paper.

is_executed.justification: Issues of execution on hardware are not discussed in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Any actual execution or experimentation is beyond the paper's scope.

is_compared.justification: It discusses its role within literature but not directly comparing numerically to others in this paper.
is_compared.quote: ListBERT is included without a setting of comparative measurement against other methods.

referenced_paper_title.value: ListBERT: Learning to rank e-commerce products with listwise BERT
referenced_paper_title.justification: The foundational technique within the discussed model is handled in the reference attributed to Kumar and Sarkar.

name.justification: The paper mentions a recurrent neural network (RNN)-based listwise ranker developed by Yan et al.
name.quote: Yan et al. (2020) propose a listwise ranker based on a recurrent neural network (RNN) auto-encoder for ranking biomedical question-answer pairs.

is_contributed.justification: An existing methodology is detailed as part of a survey.

is_executed.justification: The focus remains theoretical on methods and applications, rather than execution of models.
is_executed.quote: The focus remains theoretical rather than execution-focused.

is_compared.justification: No numerical comparisons were reported between the Listwise Ranker and other models within this survey content.
is_compared.quote: Listing rather than numerical comparison was the focus with the mention of the Listwise Ranker.

referenced_paper_title.value: List-wise learning to rank biomedical question-answer pairs with deep ranking recursive autoencoders
referenced_paper_title.justification: The techniques and applications around the Listwise Ranker have been laid out in the underlying paper about biomedical ranking published by Yan et al.

name.justification: The paper refers to research exploring ChatGPT's ranking abilities in a set of tasks.
name.quote: Ji et al. (2023) investigated ChatGPT’s ability to rank the outputs of various models on a diverse set of tasks including NLP tasks and open-ended generation tasks.

is_contributed.justification: It forms part of the survey overview, originated from other literature studies around AI models.

is_executed.justification: Execution in empirical ways is discussed in other works reviewed but not within the faculty of this paper itself.
is_executed.quote: Reviewed research on model capabilities but sans executions in-house.

is_compared.justification: Numerical performance metrics are outside its main review of ChatGPT as a conceptual entity.
is_compared.quote: Discussed as one key feature without comparative metrics laid out directly here.

referenced_paper_title.value: Exploring ChatGPT’s ability to rank content: A preliminary study on consistency with human preferences
referenced_paper_title.justification: The conceptual understanding of the discussed model exists markedly in the cited foundational paper for ChatGPT capabilities by Ji et al.

name.justification: RankVicuna is a zero-shot listwise document reranker mentioned in the paper.
name.quote: RankVicuna: Zero-shot listwise document reranking with open-source large language models.

is_contributed.justification: RankVicuna is mentioned as part of existing literature rather than a new contribution.
is_contributed.quote: RankVicuna is mentioned as existing work.

is_executed.justification: Execution specifics are not detailed in the context of this paper.
is_executed.quote: Focus remains on discussing across literature models.

is_compared.justification: Existing research work's conceptual highlights appear in discussion, not model comparisons.
is_compared.quote: It is examined discretely and without numerical contrast.

referenced_paper_title.quote: RankVicuna: Zero-shot listwise document reranking with open-source large language models.

name.justification: RankZephyr is discussed as an effective zero-shot listwise reranker in recent literature.
name.quote: RankZephyr: Effective and robust zero-shot listwise reranking is a breeze.

is_contributed.justification: RankZephyr is described in literary context rather than as an original finding or model from this survey study.
is_contributed.quote: RankZephyr as research work is cited rather than contributed by the survey.

is_executed.justification: Execution tests and details are not mentioned within the studied content about RankZephyr.
is_executed.quote: Ranks methods are listed but execution remains outside the theoretical scope.

is_compared.justification: RankZephyr's abilities are conceptually discussed but not quantitatively compared in the body of this paper.
is_compared.quote: Comparative numerical attributes were not extensively detailed.

referenced_paper_title.value: RankZephyr: Effective and robust zero-shot listwise reranking is a breeze!
referenced_paper_title.justification: The reference examines RankZephyr and its associated scientific discussions.
referenced_paper_title.quote: RankZephyr: Effective and robust zero-shot listwise reranking is a breeze!

name.justification: LlamaIndex is mentioned relative to providing interfaces for ranked structured information.
name.quote: Recent work on LlamaIndex provides an interface for connecting LLMs with indexed, textual data to be ranked.

is_contributed.justification: It is cited as part of a referenced study rather than a new contribution to infrastructure being discussed.
is_contributed.quote: LlamaIndex citations reflect referencing rather than contribution.

is_executed.justification: The survey offers discussions on its existence rather than execution descriptions and results.
is_executed.quote: LlamaIndex observed in collective findings but sans execution mentions.

is_compared.justification: Discusses infrastructure without direct execution or numerically detailed comparison.
is_compared.quote: Collection-based introductions without direct comparisons in numerical terms.

name.justification: LangChain is discussed regarding its utility for building interfaces to rank textual data with LLMs.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Insight into LangChain's role prominently features in referenced studies apart from this paper's internal contribution or experimental sections.
